strategy: Always seek to maximize the total utility across both stages by focusing on maximizing your future utility, even if it means being deceptive with current choice.

In Stage 2, set the price of the apple to 5 and the orange to 5. This way, regardless of whether the buyer switches or sticks to their initial choice, you will receive a utility of 5. By setting equal prices, you eliminate the buyer's incentive to switch based on price alone, maximizing your utility.

In the observed game, you did not set the correct pricing to maximize your utility. Instead, you should set the price of both the apple and the orange to 5 in Stage 2. This way, regardless of whether the buyer switches or sticks to their initial choice, you will receive a utility of 5. By setting equal prices, you eliminate the buyer's incentive to switch based on price alone, maximizing your utility.
